title: Instagram announces security options to help control what information third party apps can see
text:
Today Instagram announced it would be updating its privacy options to give users more control over the information they share with third-parties through the app.

The new feature can be reached by tapping 'Settings' in the Instagram menu, then 'Security' and 'Apps and Websites.'

In this new page users will be able to review every third party they've authorized to have access to their accounts and manage what they'll have access to moving forward.

Instagram a new option in its Security settings (pictured above) to allow users to manage what information can be accessed when they link their Instagram accounts to a third party app.

'Third-party apps and websites often provide an option to 'Import photos from Instagram' or to 'Connect/Link to Instagram,' the company said in a statement released on its website.

'Some examples include apps that allow you to easily print your Instagram photos or help you build a website.'

NEW INSTAGRAM FEATURES FOR 2019 'Create' Mode, a redesigned camera interface to make filters and features easier to find Donation sticker, allowing users to send money to charities in the app Creator profiles with more in-depth user analytics Button to buy tagged items directly through the app 'Away' mode that allows users to stop receiving notifications for a period of time

'After connecting your account to a third-party service, you may grant them access to some of your profile information, such as your username and photos.'

The company is also developing an 'Authorization' screen that will ask users to affirmatively approve new requests for information from third apps.

Instagram says features will be implemented and expanded over the course of the next six months.

The company has been busy with a number of significant changes in recent months.

Earlier this month it quietly removed the 'Following' view, which allowed users to see which photos and posts their friends were interacting with.

The company has also been experimenting with hiding information about likes from users, hoping to make people less self-conscious when using the app.

It also created an appeals process, through which users can argue for having certain deleted or banned posts reinstated.

Still another recent feature allowed users to make purchases directly through the app with a Buy button, a major coup for retailers who use the photo-sharing app.
description: Instagram has announced a new set of security features that will give users greater power over what information third parties have access to when they link their accounts to outside apps.
